Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery large chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; above, part of lotus flower with added red centre and added white outline; below, row of alternating red and white blobs between pairs of white bands; exterior: part of a sphinx’s head, to right.
Curator's comments: According to Lemos, sphinxes depicted on Simple Animal Style vases are usually facing left. Those facing right are probably part of an antithetical composition of confronting sphinxes. If this sherd is part of an antithetical composition, then the vessel should belong in the Group of Antithetical Sphinxes. Sherds in this group are stylistically early.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 288, no. 851, pl. 118)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1040) (phase 2)
